definition: to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion

sentences.english: In general, Su Qin's unite means is called a variable means.
sentences.chinese: 一般地说，苏秦“合纵术”被世人冠之以权变之术。

sentences.english: Most solutions came from workarounds found by third parties.
sentences.chinese: 大部分来自权变措施的方案都是由第三方发现的。

sentences.english: Every contingency must work in all browsers.
sentences.chinese: 每一种权变都应当在所有的浏览器中起作用。

sentences.english: The best contingency design prevents errors from occurring.
sentences.chinese: 最好的权变设计可防止错误的产生。

sentences.english: Fiedler Contingency Theory's predictive function to leadership effectiveness needs to be further studied.
sentences.chinese: 菲德勒权变理论对领导效能的预测功能需进一步探讨。

sentences.english: Great contingency design never gets in the way.
sentences.chinese: 好的权变设计永远不会碍事。

sentences.english: Chapter six is"the conservativeness and change of the civil procedural judicial system in the Early Republican".
sentences.chinese: 第六章“民初民事诉讼审判制度的泥守与权变”。

sentences.english: Preserving the structure of the state, gathering the valiant and courageous are what the Middle Strategy is.
sentences.chinese: 保全国家，收罗英雄，就是《中略》所论的权变。

definition: art of politics/political tricks (often derog.)/power play/to play at politics/underhand trickery
pragmatic/flexible/to act differently in different situations/to accommodate to circumstances
magnanimous on the outside, but hateful on the inside (idiom)
to plan and consider/to reflect on one's best strategy
to judge the hour and size up the situation/to take stock
high sounding and impractical/high flown nonsense
